Who was Dr. Luis W. Alvarez?

Home / supernova

Before you embark on your journey to earn the Dr. Luis W. Alvarez Award, you should discover more about who the award is named after. One of the requirements of the award (Requirement #3) is to do the following:

  1. Find interesting facts about Dr. Luis W. Alvarez using resources in your school or local library or on the Internet (with your parent’s or guardian’s permission and guidance).
  2. Discuss what you learn with your mentor, including answers to the following questions:
    • What very important award did Dr. Alvarez earn?
    • What was his famous theory about dinosaurs?

To get you started, this is what Wikipedia says about Dr. Alvarez…

Luis Walter Alvarez was an American experimental physicist, inventor, and professor who was awarded the _____ _____ __ _______ in 1968 . The American Journal of Physics commented, "Luis Alvarez was one of the most brilliant and productive experimental physicists of the twentieth century."

Now it is up to you to find information about Dr. Alvarez, and answer the questions above.

Here are a few places to start:

  • Dr. Luis W. Alvarez on YouTube (1:36)
  • Dr. Luis W. Alvarez on YouTube (4:25)
  • Dr. Lis W. Alvarez on FamousScientists.org

Popular Questions

  • Do I have to know a lot about science first?
  • What is the scientific method?
  • Are there really only 10 types of people in the world?
  • Will robots rule the earth?
  • Which makes a pinewood derby car faster, aerodynamics or graphite?
  • Does E really equal mc squared?
  • Why do people say 1 + 1 = 3?
  • Can I use a calculator?

Do you want to start a STEM program in your unit?

Everything you need to get started is here for you, and its free.

Learn How

About Us

Nova STEM Labs is a personal project by Doug Seven to create journeys for Cub Scouts who are interested in STEM and are trying to earn their Nova STEM awards. This site is also designed to enable Cub Scouts leaders to teach STEM topics to Scouts.

All content Nove STEM Labs © 2019 - All rights reserved.
